Class CreateLevelScreen

java.lang.Object
pacman.CreateLevelScreen
public class CreateLevelScreen extends Object
Screen for creating custom Pacman game levels. This class provides a visual level editor where users can: - Set level dimensions - Place game elements (walls, points, ghosts, etc.) - Save custom levels to files
Author:
Danilo Spera

    • TILE_SIZE

      private static final int TILE_SIZE
      Size of each tile in pixels
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • levelGrid

      private char[][] levelGrid
      matrix storing the level layout where each char represents a game element: W = Wall, G = Gate, K = Key, o = Point, P = Player, C = Ghost, . = Empty

    • gridWidth

      private int gridWidth
      Width and height of the level grid in tiles

      Currently selected tile type to place on the grid

      public CreateLevelScreen()

  • Method Details

    • show

      public void show(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage, Runnable onBack)
      Displays the level creation interface with the following components: - Text field for level name - Width and height input fields - Grid creation button - Editable game grid - Toolbar with placeable game elements - Save and back buttons
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The main stage of the application
      onBack - A Runnable to execute when the back button is pressed

    • createGrid

      private void createGrid()
      Creates the level grid with specified dimensions.

    • createTileButton

      private void createTileButton(javafx.scene.layout.HBox container, javafx.scene.image.Image image, char tileType)
      Creates a button for selecting a tile type.
      Parameters:
      container - Container to add the button to
      image - Image for the tile
      tileType - Character representing the tile type

    • placeTile

      private void placeTile(int row, int col)
      Places the currently selected tile type at the specified grid position. Updates both the internal levelGrid array and the visual representation.

    • getTileImage

      private javafx.scene.image.Image getTileImage(char tile)
      Returns the appropriate image for each tile type. Maps character representations (W,G,K,etc.) to their visual images.

    • saveLevel

      private void saveLevel(String levelName)
      Saves the current level to a file.
      Parameters:
      levelName - The name of the level to save, if already exists, it will be overwritten

    • updateTileVisual

      private void updateTileVisual(int row, int col, char tileType)
      Updates the visual representation of a tile.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the tile
      col - The column index of the tile
      tileType - The character representing the tile type
